Hi — I'm Sarvesh Dhamane

Mechanical Engineer

I combine mechanical design instincts with cloud & AI tooling to prototype, simulate, and manufacture robust systems. I enjoy vehicle dynamics, FEA-driven design, embedded systems, and building dashboards that connect physical sensors to the cloud.

About

I am an undergraduate Mechanical Engineer (PCCOE, 2023–27) focused on vehicle dynamics, FEA-driven design, and practical manufacturing. I combine mechanical systems thinking with embedded prototyping (Arduino / microcontrollers) and cloud dashboards to prototype, test and iterate physical systems faster. Recent work spans brake-disc FEA optimization, suspension & steering calculations, and manufacturing using lathe, VMC and M1TR processes.

Projects

Team Kratos Racing (Formula Bharat 2025)

Brake disc optimization and suspension design for EV race car.

Role: Vehicle Dynamics & Manufacturing

Contributed to the dynamics and manufacturing of Thunderblade 5.0 — an all-electric Formula-Student race car. Performed FEA-based brake disc optimization (14 % weight reduction) using ANSYS, suspension geometry and steering-system calculations. Oversaw fabrication using lathe, M1TR and VMC, and supported composite monocoque manufacturing.

DriveEdge — Autonomous Prototype (IIT Bombay Techfest)

Arduino-based self-driving vehicle for obstacle detection and lane following.

Focus: Embedded Systems & Control

Designed a compact Arduino-based robotic car featuring ultrasonic obstacle detection, line-tracking sensors, and PID control for steering stability. Implemented efficient motor control and sensor-fusion logic for reliable navigation.

Smart Gas Cylinder Trolley

IoT-enabled system to monitor gas level and send low-alert SMS.

Highlights: Developed a load-sensor-based weighing platform with GSM alert system. Calibrated 6 kg strain-gauge sensor, displayed readings on LCD, and automated SMS alerts for refilling thresholds.

SmartCycle Rear Light System

Microcontroller-controlled LED indicator and brake light for bicycles.

Design: Built an Arduino-controlled 8×8 LED matrix tail-light system with handlebar switch controls for turn signals and brake intensity. Implemented PWM-based dimming and low-power operation.

Projects & Experience

  • Team Kratos Racing — Formula Bharat 2025 (EV Category)
    Vehicle Dynamics Member responsible for brake and suspension design, steering geometry, and FEA analysis using ANSYS. Achieved a 14% weight reduction in brake disc via topology optimization and material study.
  • DriveEdge Prototype — IIT Bombay Techfest
    Designed an autonomous Arduino-based vehicle integrating PID control, ultrasonic sensors, and motor driver circuitry.
  • Smart Gas Cylinder Trolley
    Developed a load-sensing trolley with GSM alert system for low gas level notifications; implemented LCD interface and threshold logic.
  • SmartCycle Rear Light System
    Built an Arduino-controlled rear lighting system with 8x8 LED matrix, PWM-based brightness control, and handlebar indicators.
